unnormalised: ## Time Flies When You're Reporting the News (Especially in India!)
normalised: ## Time Flies When You're Reporting the News (Especially in India!)

unnormalised: So, another week bites the dust, or as we say in India, *phataak se nikal gaya!* And what a week it's been for dates and times, eh? From the usual astrological predictions gone hilariously wrong (again!), to the never-ending saga of "when will the monsoon *actually* arrive?", the clock's been ticking and the news hasn't stopped.
normalised: So, another week bites the dust, or as we say in India, *phataak se nikal gaya!* And what a week it's been for dates and times, eh? From the usual astrological predictions gone hilariously wrong (again!), to the never-ending saga of "when will the monsoon *actually* arrive?", the clock's been ticking and the news hasn't stopped.

unnormalised: First up, let’s talk about elections. Remember that small-town election everyone was so excited about? Well, turns out the declared result on 16/05/2024 was slightly off. By, oh, a mere 2000 votes! Oops. Talk about a delayed recount…scheduled now for 23/05/2024 at 10:00 AM. Someone needs a stronger cup of chai.

unnormalised: And speaking of tea breaks, who can forget the great "Chai-Gate" of '24? It all started when a news outlet accidentally reported that the Prime Minister’s address was starting at 11.30 AM when it was actually supposed to start at 11:30 PM. The internet went wild! #ChaiTimeConfusion trended for a solid 12 hrs.

unnormalised: Then, there’s the classic Indian Railways time warp. Apparently, Train No. 12345, the Howrah Mail, was only *slightly* delayed. How slight? Just a casual 27 hrs. Scheduled to arrive on 18/05/2024 at 6:00 AM, it finally chugged into the station on 19/05/2024 around 9:00 AM-ish. Time is just a suggestion, apparently, when you're travelling by rail.

unnormalised: And let’s not forget the ever-reliable astrologers! According to Panditji, a major planetary alignment was supposed to happen on 20/05/2024 at precisely 3:17 PM, promising world peace and unlimited samosas for everyone. As of 5:00 PM, samosas are still limited, and my neighbor is still arguing about parking. So, maybe next time, Panditji?

unnormalised: Oh, and the monsoon? Last forecast said it was due on 01/06/2024. Now, the meteorologists are pushing it to somewhere around the 10th -15th of June. Because, you know, Mother Nature also runs on Indian Standard Time, which is roughly translated as "ish".

unnormalised: In other news, the deadline to file income tax returns has, unsurprisingly, been extended. Again. The last date, initially set for 31/07/2024, has been pushed back to 31/08/2024. Procrastinators, rejoice!

unnormalised: But the real highlight? A news channel accidentally aired a cooking show segment during the 9:00 PM news bulletin. Yes, you heard that right. Instead of political debates, viewers were treated to a detailed demonstration of how to make the perfect *aloo paratha*. Who needs geopolitical analysis when you have delicious carbs?

unnormalised: So, as the clock strikes another hour (or two, depending on which clock you’re looking at), we're reminded that in India, time is more of a flexible concept. A guideline, if you will. And honestly, sometimes, it's all you can do but laugh.

unnormalised: Until next week, keep your calendars lightly penciled in, your expectations low, and your sense of humor high. And remember, according to Indian time, anything can happen…eventually!
